title: raybucks
author: raybucks
content: is it normal to getting some post deleted like I posted in quote to the other post (thanks)and my post is deleted on this forum is it normal to get post deleted in quoting thanks or something small words

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Yes!Probably someone reported it because the've seen it as:- no value post- derailing the topic- and the likes that may be considered as spam.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: When a post is deleted, it might be because of one of following reasonsThat whole thread (topic) was deleted by moderator. You won't get any notification on such deletion.You posted in a self-moderated thread and the author deleted your post.One or some forum members reported your post to moderator and one of them handled it by deleting it.One of forum moderators read around and see your post deserved to be deleted and did it without any report from forum members.This topic is not about Bitcoin discussion. Move it to either Meta or Beginners & Help board.Topics for basics about rules, posting etiquetteUnofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQNewbies - Read before postingBitcointalk posting etiquette

comments.author: OnZen
comments.body: What problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 12, 2023, 11:46:33 AMWhat problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?PossiblyTemporary ban but when you reach your fourth ban, it is a permanent ban.Nuke. If you spread malicious thing, your account will be nuked, no need for any temp ban.Quote from: hilariousandco on November 17, 2016, 12:46:01 PMFirst offence: 7 daysSecond offence: 14 daysThird offence: 30 daysFourth: Permanent ban

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 12, 2023, 11:46:33 AMWhat problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?You have no bad effects to the deleted post, just as @tranthidung already said you may discard those post.Lastly, btw moderator found your post to be spam which are likely to be; commenting irrelevantly or low effort post could be the reason why it was deleted.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on January 12, 2023, 10:48:33 AMis it normal to getting some post deleted like I posted in quote to the other post (thanks)and my post is deleted on this forum is it normal to get post deleted in quoting thanks or something small wordsAll deleted posts that were not of much use, saying thank you or a few one-line sentences, will always be treated as low-quality posts by the moderators. Get used to not thanking, instead, you can send merit if you find the post useful, and if you have nothing to give, then just take note of the information and that's it.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on January 12, 2023, 12:13:04 PMAll deleted posts that were not of much use, saying thank you or a few one-line sentences, will always be treated as low-quality posts by the moderators. Get used to not thanking, instead, you can send merit if you find the post useful, and if you have nothing to give, then just take note of the information and that's it.Since he is a newbie without merit yet he can't able to do that giving thanks to anybody should include how he solves the problem, not just thanks. Because if someone searches for the same problem and found his thread or post that includes a solution and it will help others to understand how you solve the problem. Giving only thanks or TY is considered zero or no value it is the first forum rules.

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Since the question has already been answered pretty well, OP, please lock the thread.If you don't know how, here's how you can do it:1. Scroll down to the bottom of this page.2. Look at the bottom-right side, you should see 2 bottons, "move topic", "lock topic".3. Click on "lock topic".And you are done.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on January 12, 2023, 12:13:04 PMAll deleted posts that were not of much use, saying thank you or a few one-line sentences, will always be treated as low-quality posts by the moderators. Get used to not thanking, instead, you can send merit if you find the post useful, and if you have nothing to give, then just take note of the information and that's it.Yeah that's right because if we are using only one word as our post the moderator will delete them to prevent such things on forum.The best advice for newbies is to make brief reply explaining his doubt was clear or make one post to reply to different users by quoting their reply but it can be hard for them in initial phase.So simple is to take note of it and avoid such posts.Quote from: Alone055 on January 12, 2023, 02:01:35 PMSince the question has already been answered pretty well, OP, please lock the thread.Yeah that will prevent the spam posting in this particular thread as he has been already answered by many users on his doubt so no further discussion about it needed.

comments.author: NdaMk
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 12, 2023, 11:46:33 AMWhat problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?You don't have a problem; all you have to do is try to make a more quality and informative post and make corrections to those that have already been deleted. It only helps you improve here and keeps the forum clean of spam. You can improve the quality of your posts by participating more in forum activities.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on January 12, 2023, 11:46:33 AMWhat problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?Potential loss of activity if all posts are deleted in a activity period. However, generally most users learn from their mistakes, and avoid deletion of posts by simply learning what's acceptable or not. To speed up that process, just take a look at the rules. It might seem boring, but it'll likely eliminate most of the issues you're having. Generally, thank you posts are deleted though. Unless, they offer something other more than just that.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on January 12, 2023, 10:48:33 AMis it normal to getting some post deleted like I posted in quote to the other post (thanks)and my post is deleted on this forum is it normal to get post deleted in quoting thanks or something small wordsYou're not alone, most members here in the forum experience the same as you've experienced now. Â (even me)But this mistake is put in your mind not to repeat again in the future knowing it's offensive in the forum based on the Forum Rules.Quote from: OnZen on January 12, 2023, 11:46:33 AMWhat problem should I've to face if the moderator deletes many of my posts?I didn't see banning yet here (that has a big chance) but your post count and activity might reduce as pointed out above. But I saw a DT member tagging your profile as a spammer once you've reached 50 posts deleted from the moderator which is also found on the Bpip.org.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on January 12, 2023, 10:48:33 AMis it normal to getting some post deleted like I posted in quote to the other post (thanks)and my post is deleted on this forum is it normal to get post deleted in quoting thanks or something small wordsIt's very normal that when you quote a shitpost that is meant to be deleted will go along with your own post getting deleted altogether, but if you want to avoid this from happening then you will have to always learn to edit your quote before posting by deleting the content of the quote and insert the word "snipped" then you make the post, this will make you exempted from having the same shitpost as being quoted under your profile post history, another means to avoid this is not to quote at all, just insert your own reply and make the post, but in most cases, members abstain from even replying because they know such thread will end up off topic, being locked or deleted.

comments.author: Fullcoinese
comments.body: Yes, I've seen some of your posts that were deleted by the moderator. you're just quoting someone else's post with one word or one line that has no value. you do not need to reply if you do not want to continue the discussion on the topic being discussed.if the replies from other people are useful, you can give merit if you feel the answers are sufficient and there is nothing to discuss further. if you don't have Merit, you can keep the information you receive for free as additional knowledge.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on January 13, 2023, 11:25:39 AMIt's very normal that when you quote a shitpost that is meant to be deleted will go along with your own post getting deleted altogether, but if you want to avoid this from happening then you will have to always learn to edit your quote before posting by deleting the content of the quote and insert the word "snipped" then you make the post, this will make you exempted from having the same shitpost as being quoted under your profile post history, another means to avoid this is not to quote at all, just insert your own reply and make the post, but in most cases, members abstain from even replying because they know such thread will end up off topic, being locked or deleted. This suggestion doesn't make sense. Mods typically delete the shit post that was reported or they spot along with other message that is shit post too. Your post will not gonna be deleted even if your quoted word is shit if it contains a value that can contribute to the forum such us educating other members to not copy the shit post that you quote or provide a reference to improve it. In general mods won't delete if you tag a shit post if your own post quality is good.Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on January 13, 2023, 11:25:39 AM but in most cases, members abstain from even replying because they know such thread will end up off topic, being locked or deleted. This is true. it's a waste of time to comment or partake on a shit discussion because it will surely deleted.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Alone055 on January 12, 2023, 02:01:35 PMSince the question has already been answered pretty well, OP, please lock the thread.Your post is a clear exposition on how to do it yourself but you don't expect a newbie like OP to continue to stay put after their questions have been answered. I guess they've already moved and may not likely locate this thread again to lock it. It now behoove the mods to do the needful by stepping in and locking it as that will keep spam off here.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Yes dont worry. As you keep improved on your posting those deleted post will be lessen. That is normal and we cant reverse it once deleted but you can always do to make sure that your post is of high quality and helpful others.Before Ive got tons of deleted post but dont get emotional about that since you are a newbie and thats pretty normal.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: when all you say is thank you, I think it's only natural to be deleted by the moderator. has no value in continuing the discussion on the topics covered.but it's natural to happen, you just need to give a good post only. when you ask and have received a response from another member, you can continue the discussion by quoting other people's posts with your ideas. it keeps the conversation going and growing. instead of just saying thank you, maybe you should skip the discussion.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Pandu Geddon on January 17, 2023, 08:12:48 AMwhen all you say is thank you, I think it's only natural to be deleted by the moderator. has no value in continuing the discussion on the topics covered.but it's natural to happen, you just need to give a good post only. when you ask and have received a response from another member, you can continue the discussion by quoting other people's posts with your ideas. it keeps the conversation going and growing. instead of just saying thank you, maybe you should skip the discussion.I think Welsh has answered it perfectly:Quote from: Welsh on January 12, 2023, 11:52:52 PMGenerally, thank you posts are deleted though. Unless, they offer something other more than just that.I checked the OP's post history, some of them are thank you posts without offering anything more useful. So moderators will consider it like low quality post, and it will be deleted sooner or later. Besides that, the forum rules make it very clear that:Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. [1][e]Examples:1. Such posts as "SELL SELL SELL", "I agree", "+1", "Support", "Watching", "Interesting", "LOL", "SCAM", "LEGIT", "FAKE", other one word posts, posts consisting mostly of swearing, quote pyramids, useless introduction threads, threads about a topic already recently discussed in several other threads
